nodes.bodyText:
Suppress the warning so the IDE won't flag it
@SuppressWarnings("ObjectEquality")

Can we use checkArgument for this? The parser depends on Guava already.
Also, we avoid using this. unless it's required

Re: checkArgument- I’m avoiding it here because it would incur boxing on the happy / fast path since we have more than 1 argument to interpolate.
Re: the use of “this”, I agree in this form it’s become less necessary (refactored code) but doesn’t seem to hurt given the cryptic nature of these field names and the reliance on object identity for correctness.
There's actually an overload for the two argument Object variant in Guava 20
I'd just call this field initializer for conciseness.
Rebased the PR and renamed the field.
